snippet: SAYAH--Max, born January 15, 1923, passed peacefully at home Sunday in his 93rd year. "A man for all seasons," he never wasted a minute! He was an amazingly warm, kind, compassionate, generous, and sympathetic human being. His passions were endless: sailing, music, painting and theater. Max was a true intellect, after a successful career in the garment industry, he became a NYC Assistant District Attorney, Assistant U.S. Attorney, and Acting State Supreme Court Judge appointed by Mayor Koch. Family was always of the utmost. He was predeceased by his first wife Mildred Adler and survived by his beloved wife Hannah Lesser. Max was a loving husband, brother, devoted father, stepfather, adoring grandfather and great-grandfather. A renaissance man, loved by all. Funeral: Stephen Wise Synagogue, West 68th Street, Wednesday at 11am. 1/3
